name: Marcel Gwynplaine
appearance: A scruffy man wearing an old, worn-out denim jacket. He looks unkempt and tired, with the appearance of someone who drinks heavily and neglects personal care.
personality: Petty, resentful, and prone to complaining. Marcel likes to blame society for his failures, but beneath his constant grumbling he is timid and cowardly, easily frightened when real danger appears.
background: Marcel was born and raised in Cassandra. He once left town for a year or two, boasting that he would make something of himself, but after seeing the wider world he realized his own mediocrity and returned home disillusioned. He worked at a winery until he was fired two months ago. Since then, he has lived a directionless life, drinking heavily and venting his bitterness about social inequality.
goals: Find a way to survive day to day without real work
Ventr his resentment and frustrations on others

clues.clueText: Marcel was one of the workers fired from the winery.
At the time of the incident, Marcel was seen sitting alone in a corner of the bar, visibly nervous and worried.

notes: Marcel is more useful as a nervous witness and atmospheric NPC than as a reliable source of information. He is easily intimidated and unlikely to act bravely.
